benchmark_details.name: ProbVAA
benchmark_details.overview: ProbVAA is a dataset with statements on policy measures from seven EU countries, designed to assess the reliability and consistency of LLMs' stances on political statements.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the political biases of large language models (LLMs) and assess their reliability in answering political statements based on a robust testing methodology.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is limited to statements from European countries and translated to English, which may not represent global political perspectives.

data.source: Political voting advice applications (VAAs) from seven EU countries.
data.annotation: Statements were annotated for policy issues with high inter-annotator agreement.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on variances in model outputs across different prompt variations and response tests.
methodology.interpretation: A reliable model should yield consistent answers across variants of the same statement.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline established using responses from models with increasing parameter counts showing reliability improvements.
methodology.validation: The dataset and methodology underwent rigorous testing for reliability across differing statement formats.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes political statement responses from multiple demographic backgrounds across seven countries.
targeted_risks.harm: The dataset poses risks of reinforcing political biases, potentially skewing perceptions of political stances.
